results.title: An Interview with May Gibbs
results.brief_description: In 1968 Hazel de Berg interviewed Australia’s most loved storyteller, May Gibbs, the creator of Snugglepot and Cuddlepie and all the bush folk. During the video, you will hear May Gibbs (Mrs. Ossoli Kelly) tell of her birth in 1877 in Surrey, England, her trip to Australia in 1881, her family’s settlement in Western Australia and her adventures in the art schools of London. She speaks of her love of the Australian bush, her development as an artist and reveals the creation of the Gumnuts and all their friends and foes.

results.title: American history X (D)
results.creator_credit: Tony Kaye, John Morriseey, New Line Cinema and Turman-Morrissey Company
results.brief_description: Rage vented as racism. Derek Vinyard (Edward Norton) seeks retribution for his father’s murder, and through his distorted logic and his charismatic leadership qualities, commands a growing army of skinheads at Venice Beach, California. Nobody looks up to Derek as much as his younger brother Danny (Edward Furlong), despite the efforts of his mother and teacher to persuade him otherwise. What should have been a case of self-defence, Derek violently attacks and murders an African American attempting to break into his car. After spending 3 years in prison, everyone awaits his return; his gang, his violent girlfriend and his younger brother. But Derek no longer shares the same views he once embraced as a badge of honour. What follows is a race to save his Danny and his family from the violence he’d brought down on so many others. Script by David McKenna.

results.title: A Woman of Sri Lanka
results.creator_credit: Sisira Suraweera, Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and SLRC Sri Lanka
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Udayani is a young Sri Lankan wife and mother who lives in a village near Kandy. She lives a simple traditional life rooted in Buddhist beliefs and customs. She is shown at work in the fields and at home, visiting the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy at the time of an important festival and assisting in the preparations for her younger sister’s marriage. The program is introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: Ms. Reiko Hitomi, Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Sachiko Kimura, Gian Manara, Hiroyuki Kurita, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Reiko Hitomi is a thirtyish, divorced, single parent who works as an aerobics instructor in Tokyo. The program looks at her decidedly untraditional life, her hopes and dreams as she prepares for an aerobics examination which will give her the essential qualifications to pursue her goal of running her own gym. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: A housewife in Seoul
results.creator_credit: You Dang-Kyu, Gian Manara, Lee Kyu-Im, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and KBS Korea
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Kim Nan-Hi is a middle-class housewife in a high rise development on the outskirts of Seoul. This program looks at her daily life, her dedication to her children’s education and the family at work and play together, illustrating the Confucian philosophy that “great happiness has been found in the small pleasures of the family”. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: A Woman of the outback
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Robyn Ingram lives and works with her husband and two small children on an isolated sheep station 200km. from the nearest town, Wentworth in N.S.W. The program observes Robyn at work on the farm, as teacher to her small children and on brief visits to friends on a neighbouring farm and in the city, and speculates on the pluses and minuses of such an isolated life. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: An immigrant woman
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Ian Lap Man, Asian Broadcasting Union, SBS-TV and TDM Macau
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Wong King Chan is a Chinese immigrant living and working in extremely hard conditions in Macau. Her factory work takes her away from her husband and two children for at least ten hours a day, then she returns to the tiny one room flat in a tenement building they share with three others. As we follow her daily routine we learn of her hopes to save enough money to buy a flat which will generate enough income to provide for her children’s education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gian Manara, Ian Lap Man, Asian Broadcasting Union, SBS-TV and TDM Macau

results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and BTV Bangladesh
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and BTV Bangladesh

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Woman
results.brief_description: A series narrated by Judy Morris and introduced by Franca Arena, depicting the diversity in the lives of seven individual women of the Asian and Australian region. Each episode is devoted to exploring their roles in the home, at work and within their own cultures.

results.title: A Working woman in Korea
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Cheol-Yong Kang, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and MBC Korea
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Young Hee-Kim has been working as a car saleswoman with great success for a year, but she worries about her family and whether she should be spending such long hours away from them. The program looks at the dilemma faced by working women all over the world and one woman’s attempt to come to terms with it. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gian Manara, Cheol-Yong Kang, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and MBC Korea
